turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Greg Abbott.
turn.2: At issue was the so-called "bathroom bill," which would require transgender people to use the bathroom of the sex listed on their birth certificates, not the one of their choice.
turn.3: Was this bill signed into law?
turn.4: The bill was revived by Abbott and supported by Republican lieutenant governor Dan Patrick.
turn.5: What other interesting information is there about this bill?
turn.6: In March 2018, Byron Cook, the chairman of the House State Affairs committee who blocked the bill, claimed that Abbott privately opposed the bill.
turn.7: Was there any other controversy involving this bill?
turn.8: The bill was never signed; Abbott later stated that "it's not on my agenda," in a debate with Lupe Valdez, the Democratic candidate for governor in 2018.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: In 2017, Abbott signed legislation to allow taxpayer-funded adoption agencies to refuse same-sex families from adopting children.
turn.11: Did he sign any other bills?
turn.12: In 2017, Abbott signed a bill into law enacting a statewide ban on texting while driving.
